body: LEAD: Reports of incidents of racial assaults in which blacks and whites were injured in New York City in the first eight months of this year have already significantly exceeded the number of such assaults in all of 1986, according to police statistics. Reports of incidents of racial assaults in which blacks and whites were injured in New York City
title: Reports of Racial Assaults Rise Significantly in New York City

body: LEAD: Three black teen-agers and two Hispanicyouths were chased out of a Brooklyn park Wednesday night by a group of about 10 white youths who attacked two of them with a stick and a bottle, the police said yesterday. Three black teen-agers and two Hispanicyouths were chased out of a Brooklyn park Wednesday night by a group of about 10 white youths
title: Whites Attack Minority Youths

body: LEAD: Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Friday PILAR RIOJA DANCES Pilar Rioja, renowned for her remarkable repertory of Spanish dance, begins a 15-day engagement tonight at the Repertorio Espanol's Gramercy Arts Theater, at 138 East 27th Street. title: GOING OUT GUIDE

body: LEAD: Folk Art Institute Workshops Folk Art Institute Workshops Museum of American Folk Art, 444 Park Avenue South (30th Street); 212-481-3080. Registration is under way for day and evening classes and workshops that will begin Sept. 8. Four new courses will be offered, including a workshop that will examine the care, conservation and restoration
title: Events; Art Classes and a Brooklyn Tour

body: LEAD: Urban Oases Urban Oases One of the more civilized outposts of urban serenity is Il Nido Cafe, in the lobby of the building at 875 Third Avenue (52d Street). title: FOOD NOTES

body: LEAD: The Barnum Wood Elementary School seems almost to be squirming with activity today. Some pupils are trooping to lunch; others are cheering in the gym. body: LEAD: A Brooklyn youth who had told the police that he shot and killed a Roman Catholic priest during a sexual encounter last May was acquitted yesterday of murder charges in the slaying. title: BROOKLYN YOUTH ACQUITTED IN SLAYING OF CATHOLIC PRIEST

body: LEAD: WHEN Bill Dillard was not on the road, singing and acting in musicals or playing his trumpet with Louis Armstrong, he lived in rental apartments in Harlem.
